intro: Neosasamorpha oshidensis subsp. glabra, commonly known as the smooth neosasamorpha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The subspecies is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists studying tropical flora.
